data.title: WILLIAM LEWIS

data.text:
William H. Lewis, 78, a 40 year resident of Lansdale, died April 29, 2008 in Hahnemann University Hospital, Philadelphia. He was the husband of Barbara M. (Fisher) Lewis and they would have observed their 53rd wedding anniversary, June 2. Barbara is employed by the North Penn School District as an area supervisor. Born in Attleboro, MA, he was the son of the late William H. and Viola (Washburn) Lewis. He served in the U.S. Army during the Korean War.Mr. Lewis established a very successful marketing business in the building materials industry. He was a member of St. Stanislaus Church.He had been active with the Boy Scouts of America. Most of all, he was a loving husband, father, grandfather and great-grandfather.Surviving, in addition to his wife, are three sons, William H. Lewis III and his wife, Martha B., of Telford, Mark B. Lewis and his fiancee, Donna Wampole, of Lansdale and Bradford M. Lewis and his wife, Susan Lynn, of Quakertown; four grandchildren, Courtney Goshow and Brandon, Tiffany and Austin Lewis; and three great-grandchildren. Also surviving is a sister, Betty Czarnecki, of Grand Rapids, MI.Relatives and friends may greet the family Saturday, May 3 between 9:30 and 10:45 AM and are invited to attend his Funeral Mass at 11 AM in St. Stanislaus Church, Lansdale. Interment will be private at a later date. In lieu of flowers, donations in his memory may be made to American Heart Assoc., 777 Penn Center Blvd., Suite 200, Pittsburgh, PA 15235. Arrangements are by Huff & Lakjer Funeral Home in Lansdale.

Originally Published: April 30, 2008 at 5:49 a.m.
